question: Question 13-12/19/2012 A reactor pool contains 106, 000 gallons of water at 90 degrees F, and it heats up to 93 degrees F in two hours. Assuming no ambient losses, the calculated reactor power level is ______.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Power = mcΔT/Δt , where: m=106,000 gallons x 8.34 lbs/gal = 884,040 lb; c=1 Btu/̊F-lb; ΔT/Δt = 1.5 degrees/hour. Power = 1,326,060 Btu/hour; 3413 Btu/hour = 1 kW. Power = 1,326,060/3413 = 389 kW.

Incorrect. Power = mcΔT/Δt , where: m=106,000 gallons x 8.34 lbs/gal = 884,040 lb; c=1 Btu/̊F-lb; ΔT/Δt = 1.5 degrees/hour. Power = 1,326,060 Btu/hour; 3413 Btu/hour = 1 kW. Power = 1,326,060/3413 = 389 kW.
Correct.

Incorrect. Power = mcΔT/Δt , where: m=106,000 gallons x 8.34 lbs/gal = 884,040 lb; c=1 Btu/̊F-lb; ΔT/Δt = 1.5 degrees/hour. Power = 1,326,060 Btu/hour; 3413 Btu/hour = 1 kW. Power = 1,326,060/3413 = 389 kW.
